title: Tyson Fury says Deontay Wilder's next fight bigger threat to rematch
text:
Fury has told Wilder to concentrate on his own fight (Picture: AP)

Tyson Fury has warned Deontay Wilder to concentrate on his next fight or risk making the same mistake Anthony Joshua did.

The Gypsy King’s imminent debut in the WWE has drawn scorn from Wilder, with the WBC champion accusing his rival of trying to engineer a way to pull out of their rematch in February.

Wilder believes Fury will fake injury in the WWE match and then scrap their much-anticipated second showdown.

‘Everyone is asking me about Wilder,’ Fury says, almost annoyed, in a sit-down with Metro.co.uk. last week in London.

After hearing exactly what Wilder had to say about his motivations for crossing over into WWE, Fury quipped: ‘They’re all true. You can’t really take what he says too serious.’

Wilder has his own fight to contend with before his 22 February clash with Fury. A rematch with Luis Ortiz is scheduled for 23 November in Las Vegas.

Fury, clearly unimpressed with Wilder’s latest comments, pointed to the American’s upcoming fight as the bigger danger to their rematch than his appearance in WWE.

‘Doesn’t Deontay Wilder have to take care of business in November?,’ he said.

‘He should’t be concentrating on what I’m doing. He should be concentrating on what he’s doing.

Wilder fights Ortiz in their rematch at the end of November (Picture: Rex Features)

‘Win that fight first. People always make the mistake of looking at the next opponent – bigger paydays and bigger profiles.

‘Many people have looked past the actual event to bigger events and come unstuck in the smaller hurdles.

‘My advice to Deontay would be win against Luis Ortiz and then we’ll see where we go from there. If he loses against Ortiz then the fight with me is out.’

One heavyweight who was guilty of overlooking an opponent is Joshua. The former unified champion was knocked out by massive underdog Andy Ruiz Jr last June and will rematch the Mexican in December.

With so much riding on Joshua’s do-over with Ruiz Jr, Fury warned Wilder not to make the same mistake his British rival did.

‘[Anthony Joshua and Deontay Wilder] all got their own business first before they can think about what I’m doing,’ Fury insisted.

Joshua seeks revenge over Ruiz Jr in December (Picture: Getty)

‘Wilder’s got Ortiz, Ruiz has got Joshua. There’s no point in even talking about these men, but it’s very uncertain in their future.

‘He looked over Ruiz before and got knocked out. This is how much nothing is given in life. Concentrate on your own job.’

Fury takes on Braun Strowman this Thursday in his WWE debut and has not ruled out the possibility of further matches with the wrestling promotion.

description: Tyson Fury has told Deontay Wilder to concentrate on his next fight rather than spreading nonsense about his WWE debut.
